data.text: Draghi: Common supervision needs to be accompanied by resolution mechanism with strong European dimension for large, cross-border banks
Draghi: Those who suffer most from unreformed labour markets are often young people
Draghi: Structural fiscal reforms, e.g. to pension systems, also support fiscal sustainability without negative effects on economy today
Draghi: Relying less on tax increases and prioritising capital investment over current spending would do more to lay foundations for growth
Draghi: New approach necessary for growth and jobs and to sustain social models without creating unsustainable debt for future generations
Draghi: We have robustly defended the stability of our monetary union and therefore of our money. We stand ready to act again when needed.
Introductory Statement Mario Draghi at the Assemblée Nationale http://t.co/yWmouV92E5 (en) http://t.co/gWHJqYRxRn (fr)
Draghi: Fiscal consolidation unavoidable but can be made much more growth-friendly
Draghi: Structural reforms may hurt vested interests, but clearly strengthen effectiveness, competitiveness and fairness of our economies
Draghi: Monetary policy is only a small part of overall agenda for laying foundations for sustainable growth and renewed employment creation
Draghi: In terms of monetary policy, price stability is assured, and the overall economic outlook still warrants an accommodative stance
Draghi: OMT even more essential now as we see potential changes in the mon. pol. stance with associated uncertainty in other jurisdictions
Draghi: The ECB will not act to compress spreads artificially; they should reflect the underlying fiscal position of the sovereign
Draghi: Some instruments are standard, some non-standard, but all are based on the ECB Statutes
Draghi: The ECB has inherited its objective from Bundesbank, but is operating in a new and different environment using different instruments
